greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of distinct sums i + j + k with i, j, k >= 0, i*j*k = n and gcd(i,j,k) <= 1.
comment: Note that gcd(0,m) = m for any m.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10001 (terms n = 0..100 from Robert Price)
mathematica: f[n_] := Length[Complement[Union[Flatten[Table[If[i*j*k == n && GCD[i, j, k] ≤ 1, {i + j + k}], {i, 0, n}, {j, 0, n}, {k, 0, n}], 2]], {Null}]]; Table[f[n], {n, 0, 100}]
program: (PARI) A223135(n) = { my(sums=Set()); if(!n,1,fordiv(n, i, for(j=i, (n/i), if(!(n%j),for(k=j, n/(i*j), if((i*j*k==n)&&(gcd(i,gcd(j,k))<=1), sums = Set(concat(sums, (i+j+k)))))))); length(sums)); }; \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 21 2017
results.author: _Robert Price_, Jun 12 2013
